content: [Gerardo Machado](/wiki/Gerardo_Machado "Gerardo Machado") was [elected](/wiki/Cuban_general_election,_1924 "Cuban general election, 1924") [president of Cuba](/wiki/President_of_Cuba "President of Cuba") under the [Liberal](/wiki/Liberal_Party_of_Cuba "Liberal Party of Cuba")-Popular Coalition banner.
[Éamon de Valera](/wiki/%C3%89amon_de_Valera "Éamon de Valera") was sentenced to a month in prison for entering [Ulster](/wiki/Ulster "Ulster") illegally.
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 324. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content: [Club Sport Colombia](/wiki/Club_Sport_Colombia "Club Sport Colombia") was founded in [Paraguay](/wiki/Paraguay "Paraguay").

**Born:** [Süleyman Demirel](/wiki/S%C3%BCleyman_Demirel "Süleyman Demirel"), [President of Turkey](/wiki/President_of_Turkey "President of Turkey") 1993 to 2000; Prime Minister of Turkey five times between 1965 and 1993; in [İslamköy](/wiki/%C4%B0slamk%C3%B6y "İslamköy") (d. 2015)

[Uruguay](/wiki/Uruguay_national_football_team "Uruguay national football team") and [Argentina](/wiki/Argentina_national_football_team "Argentina national football team") played to a scoreless draw in the [South American Championship](/wiki/1924_South_American_Championship "1924 South American Championship") of soccer football. Uruguay finished in first place with a record of 2-1-0 (for 5 points) compared to Argentina's 1-2-0 (for 4 points), to win Uruguay's fifth [Copa América](/wiki/Copa_Am%C3%A9rica "Copa América").
[Feng Yuxiang](/wiki/Feng_Yuxiang "Feng Yuxiang")'s troops entered [Tianjin](/wiki/Tianjin "Tianjin").
sources: Fox, Charles (November 4, 1924). "Feng's Troops in Tientsin as Ex-Chief Flees". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 12.

content: [Calvin Coolidge](/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge "Calvin Coolidge") and [John W. Davis](/wiki/John_W._Davis "John W. Davis") made their final appeals to voters with radio addresses on the eve of the presidential election.
sources: "Cal's Radio to Nation: Vote!". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. November 4, 1924. p. 1.

content: The [League of Nations](/wiki/League_of_Nations "League of Nations") opened its first session of the International Opium Conference, addressing the issue of [opium](/wiki/Opium "Opium") smoking and addiction.
sources: ["Chronology 1924"](http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1924.htm). *indiana.edu*. 2002. Retrieved January 16, 2015.

content: [Calvin Coolidge](/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge "Calvin Coolidge") of the [Republican Party](/wiki/Republican_Party_(United_States) "Republican Party (United States)") was elected to a second term in the [U.S. presidential election](/wiki/1924_United_States_presidential_election "1924 United States presidential election"), as [Democratic](/wiki/Democratic_Party_(United_States) "Democratic Party (United States)") opponent [John W. Davis](/wiki/John_W._Davis "John W. Davis") nearly swept the [South](/wiki/Southern_United_States "Southern United States") but was unable to carry any other states. Third-party candidate [Robert M. La Follette](/wiki/Robert_M._La_Follette,_Sr. "Robert M. La Follette, Sr.") won his home state of [Wisconsin](/wiki/Wisconsin "Wisconsin") and its 13 electoral votes, while Coolidge had 382 electoral votes and Davis had 136.
sources: ["1924 Presidential Election"](http://www.270towin.com/1924_Election/). *270 To Win*. Retrieved January 16, 2015.

content: A violent encounter took place in Rome during parades commemorating the sixth anniversary of the Italian Armistice. Accounts vary as to what happened, but it appears that anti-Fascist war veterans objected to attempts by [Blackshirts](/wiki/Milizia_Volontaria_per_la_Sicurezza_Nazionale "Milizia Volontaria per la Sicurezza Nazionale") to join their march. Angry words were exchanged, fights broke out and a ceremony in the [Piazza Venezia](/wiki/Piazza_Venezia "Piazza Venezia") was called off. The incident became another scandal for [Benito Mussolini](/wiki/Benito_Mussolini "Benito Mussolini")'s government as even members of his inner circle were appalled at what was seen as an attack on Italy's war veterans.
sources: Sarfatti, Margherita (2014). Sullivan, Brian R. (ed.). *My Fault: Mussolini As I Knew Him*. New York: Enigma Books. pp. 109–110. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-1-936274-40-6](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-936274-40-6 "Special:BookSources/978-1-936274-40-6").
Rue, Larry (November 24, 1924). "Mussolini, the Eagle, Coos Like Dove; Saves Job". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 15.

content: [Stanley Baldwin](/wiki/Stanley_Baldwin "Stanley Baldwin") became [Prime Minister of the United Kingdom](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_the_United_Kingdom "Prime Minister of the United Kingdom") again.
**Died:** [Gabriel Fauré](/wiki/Gabriel_Faur%C3%A9 "Gabriel Fauré"), 79, French composer
Former Chinese emperor [Puyi](/wiki/Puyi "Puyi") was expelled from the [Forbidden City](/wiki/Forbidden_City "Forbidden City") and all Manchu titles were abolished.
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 324. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content: [Nikola Pašić](/wiki/Nikola_Pa%C5%A1i%C4%87 "Nikola Pašić") became [Prime Minister of Yugoslavia](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Yugoslavia "Prime Minister of Yugoslavia") for the second time.
The [A. A. Milne](/wiki/A._A._Milne "A. A. Milne") poetry collection *[When We Were Very Young](/wiki/When_We_Were_Very_Young "When We Were Very Young")* was published.

[Winston Churchill](/wiki/Winston_Churchill "Winston Churchill") was named [Chancellor of the Exchequer](/wiki/Chancellor_of_the_Exchequer "Chancellor of the Exchequer"), a surprising move on the part of [Stanley Baldwin](/wiki/Stanley_Baldwin "Stanley Baldwin") as Churchill had no experience in finance.
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 324. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content:
**Born:**
	* [Harlon Block](/wiki/Harlon_Block "Harlon Block"), U.S. marine and [flag raiser on Iwo Jima](/wiki/Raising_the_Flag_on_Iwo_Jima "Raising the Flag on Iwo Jima"), in [Yorktown, Texas](/wiki/Yorktown,_Texas "Yorktown, Texas") (d. 1945)
	* [Jeanette Schmid](/wiki/Jeanette_Schmid "Jeanette Schmid"), notable whistler, in [Volary](/wiki/Volary "Volary"), [Sudetenland](/wiki/Sudetenland "Sudetenland"), [Czechoslovakia](/wiki/Czechoslovakia "Czechoslovakia") (d. 2005)

[Harlon Block](/wiki/Harlon_Block "Harlon Block"), U.S. marine and [flag raiser on Iwo Jima](/wiki/Raising_the_Flag_on_Iwo_Jima "Raising the Flag on Iwo Jima"), in [Yorktown, Texas](/wiki/Yorktown,_Texas "Yorktown, Texas") (d. 1945)

[Jeanette Schmid](/wiki/Jeanette_Schmid "Jeanette Schmid"), notable whistler, in [Volary](/wiki/Volary "Volary"), [Sudetenland](/wiki/Sudetenland "Sudetenland"), [Czechoslovakia](/wiki/Czechoslovakia "Czechoslovakia") (d. 2005)
Germany announced its first balanced budget since the war.
sources: [Seldes, George](/wiki/George_Seldes "George Seldes") (November 8, 1924). "German Budget Balanced; Will Finance Farmer". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 3.

content: The [Ignaz Seipel](/wiki/Ignaz_Seipel "Ignaz Seipel") government resigned in Austria.
sources: Wales, Henry (November 9, 1924). "Austrian Strike May Bring New European Storm". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 3.

content: Soviet troops massed intimidatingly on the border with [Estonia](/wiki/Estonia "Estonia") on the eve of the [trial of the 149](/wiki/Trial_of_the_149 "Trial of the 149") beginning.
sources: Day, Donald (November 10, 1924). "Russia Tries to Curb Esthonian Trial of Reds". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 23.

content: The silent drama film *[He Who Gets Slapped](/wiki/He_Who_Gets_Slapped_(film) "He Who Gets Slapped (film)")*, starring [Lon Chaney](/wiki/Lon_Chaney "Lon Chaney"), was released.
**Born:** [Robert Frank](/wiki/Robert_Frank "Robert Frank"), Swiss photographer; in [Zürich](/wiki/Z%C3%BCrich "Zürich") (d. 2019)
**Died:** [Henry Cabot Lodge](/wiki/Henry_Cabot_Lodge "Henry Cabot Lodge"), 74, U.S. Senator and historian
Ranch property belonging to Mexican president-elect [Plutarco Elías Calles](/wiki/Plutarco_El%C3%ADas_Calles "Plutarco Elías Calles") was expropriated by the state in accordance with agrarian laws.
sources: Neumeier, Frederick (November 11, 1924). "Mexicans Seize Land of Calles, New President". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 18.

content: The [Martin Beck](/wiki/Martin_Beck_(vaudeville) "Martin Beck (vaudeville)") Theatre (now the [Al Hirschfeld Theatre](/wiki/Al_Hirschfeld_Theatre "Al Hirschfeld Theatre")) opened in New York City.

**Born:** [Evelyn Wawryshyn](/wiki/Evelyn_Wawryshyn "Evelyn Wawryshyn"), Canadian born baseball player in the [AAGPBL](/wiki/AAGPBL "AAGPBL"), inductee to the [Canadian Baseball Hall of Fame](/wiki/Canadian_Baseball_Hall_of_Fame "Canadian Baseball Hall of Fame"); in [Tyndall, Manitoba](/wiki/Rural_Municipality_of_Brokenhead "Rural Municipality of Brokenhead") (d. 2022)

A new session of Italian parliament opened with 185 opposition members absent in protest. This boycott became known as the [Aventine Secession](/wiki/Aventine_Secession_(20th_century) "Aventine Secession (20th century)").
sources: Rue, Larry (November 13, 1924). "Parliament of Italy Shunned by 185 Members". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 3.

content: The [Tientsin Conference](/wiki/Tientsin_Conference "Tientsin Conference") began with powerful [warlords](/wiki/List_of_warlords_and_military_cliques_in_the_Warlord_Era "List of warlords and military cliques in the Warlord Era") meeting to discuss the future government of [China](/wiki/Beiyang_government "Beiyang government") and hopefully reconcile with [Sun Yat-sen](/wiki/Sun_Yat-sen "Sun Yat-sen")'s  [rival government](/wiki/Army_and_Navy_Marshal_stronghold_of_the_Republic_of_China "Army and Navy Marshal stronghold of the Republic of China") in [Canton](/wiki/Guangzhou "Guangzhou").
sources: ["CHINESE FACTIONS HOLD CONFERENCES; Feng and Chang Meet With Tuan in Tientsin as Wu's Friends Gather in Nanking"](https://www.nytimes.com/1924/11/12/archives/chinese-factions-hold-conferences-feng-and-chang-meet-with-tuan-in.html?searchResultPosition=4). *The New York Times*. Associated Press. Retrieved 6 March 2021.

content: [Mussolini](/wiki/Benito_Mussolini "Benito Mussolini") introduced a bill allowing women to vote in national elections in Italy.
sources: Mercer, Derrik (1989). *Chronicle of the 20th Century*. London: Chronicle Communications Ltd. p. 324. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-582-03919-3](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3 "Special:BookSources/978-0-582-03919-3").

content:
**Born:**
	* [Motoo Kimura](/wiki/Motoo_Kimura "Motoo Kimura"), Japanese geneticist; in [Okazaki](/wiki/Okazaki,_Aichi "Okazaki, Aichi"), [Aichi prefecture](/wiki/Aichi_prefecture "Aichi prefecture") (d. 1994)
	* [Edward F. Welch, Jr.](/wiki/Edward_F._Welch,_Jr. "Edward F. Welch, Jr."), U.S. Navy admiral; in [Barrington, Rhode Island](/wiki/Barrington,_Rhode_Island "Barrington, Rhode Island") (d. 2008)
[Motoo Kimura](/wiki/Motoo_Kimura "Motoo Kimura"), Japanese geneticist; in [Okazaki](/wiki/Okazaki,_Aichi "Okazaki, Aichi"), [Aichi prefecture](/wiki/Aichi_prefecture "Aichi prefecture") (d. 1994)
[Edward F. Welch, Jr.](/wiki/Edward_F._Welch,_Jr. "Edward F. Welch, Jr."), U.S. Navy admiral; in [Barrington, Rhode Island](/wiki/Barrington,_Rhode_Island "Barrington, Rhode Island") (d. 2008)

In New York City, the explorers [Roald Amundsen](/wiki/Roald_Amundsen "Roald Amundsen") and [Lincoln Ellsworth](/wiki/Lincoln_Ellsworth "Lincoln Ellsworth") announced plans for a joint polar flight expedition in 1925.
sources: Bart, Sheldon (2013). [*Race to the Top of the World: Richard Byrd and the First Flight to the North Pole*](https://archive.org/details/racetotopofworld0000bart/page/63). Washington, D.C.: Regnery Publishing. p. [63](https://archive.org/details/racetotopofworld0000bart/page/63). [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-1-62157-082-0](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1-62157-082-0 "Special:BookSources/978-1-62157-082-0").

content: **Died:** [Joe Quest](/wiki/Joe_Quest "Joe Quest"), 71, American baseball player who played 1871 to 1886, said to have coined the term "[Charley horse](/wiki/Charley_horse "Charley horse")" to describe a sudden leg cramp or sprain.
sources: Bill James (2010). *The New Bill James Historical Baseball Abstract*. Simon & Schuster. pp. 749–750. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-1439106938](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-1439106938 "Special:BookSources/978-1439106938").
["Charley Horse Coined Phrase"](https://news.google.com/newspapers?nid=2513&dat=19060814&id=GbNGAAAAIBAJ&pg=6116,5554403). *The Meridien Morning Record*. August 14, 1906. p. 2.

["Old "Charley-Horse": The Veteran Hugh Nichol Tells How a Much Used and Graphic Term Originated in the Long Ago"](http://library.la84.org/SportsLibrary/SportingLife/1906/VOL_48_NO_06/SL4806013.pdf) (PDF). *The Sporting Life*. October 20, 1906. p. 13.

content: France clashed with the United States over a letter from reparations agent [Seymour Parker Gilbert](/wiki/Seymour_Parker_Gilbert "Seymour Parker Gilbert") stating that Britain and France were not entitled to collect a tax of 26 percent on German imports as part of [reparations](/wiki/World_War_I_reparations "World War I reparations") payments under the [Dawes Plan](/wiki/Dawes_Plan "Dawes Plan"). France contended that the import tax had nothing to do with the Plan.
sources: [Seldes, George](/wiki/George_Seldes "George Seldes") (November 16, 1924). "Allies Clash with U.S. Head of Dawes Plan". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 5.

content: The United Kingdom angered Japan at the International Opium Conference in [Geneva](/wiki/Geneva "Geneva") when British delegate [Malcolm Delevingne](/wiki/Malcolm_Delevingne "Malcolm Delevingne") said that Great Britain could not habitually recognize import certificates, because they were often diverted on the way to the country of purchase for illicit purposes by high officials in one far eastern country that he "preferred not to name."
sources: "Japanese Bolt Opium Accord; Blame Britain". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. November 17, 1924. p. 1.

content: French troops evacuated the right bank of the [Rhine](/wiki/Rhine "Rhine") between [Cologne](/wiki/Cologne "Cologne") and [Koblenz](/wiki/Koblenz "Koblenz").
sources: "Free Ruhr Road". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. November 16, 1924. p. 5.

content: Japan essentially quit the International Opium Conference, claiming the proposed agreement was discriminatory against them and that the British delegation had offended Japan's honour.
sources: "Japanese Bolt Opium Accord; Blame Britain". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. November 17, 1924. p. 1.

content: **Born:** [Mel Patton](/wiki/Mel_Patton "Mel Patton"), U.S. track and field sprinter and 1948 Olympic gold medalist, known for settomg the world record of 9.2 seconds in the 100 yard dash in 1948 and breaking the record of [Jesse Owens](/wiki/Jesse_Owens "Jesse Owens") in the 220 yard dash in 1949; in Los Angeles (d. 2014)

The Canadian province of [Ontario](/wiki/Ontario "Ontario") said it would build a "dry navy" to co-operate with American Prohibition enforcement agents unless the Canadian federal government did more to stop [rum-running](/wiki/Rum-running "Rum-running").
sources: "Ontario Joins U.S. in Fight on Rum Runners". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. November 18, 1924. p. 16.

content: The film *[A Sainted Devil](/wiki/A_Sainted_Devil "A Sainted Devil")*, starring [Rudolph Valentino](/wiki/Rudolph_Valentino "Rudolph Valentino"), was released.

Britain asked the [League of Nations](/wiki/League_of_Nations "League of Nations") for an indefinite postponement of any further discussion on the [Geneva Protocol](/wiki/Geneva_Protocol_(1924) "Geneva Protocol (1924)").
sources: "Britain Scraps League's World Peace Protocol". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. November 18, 1924. p. 1.

content: Major-General Sir [Lee Stack](/wiki/Lee_Stack "Lee Stack"), British [Governor-General](/wiki/Governor-General "Governor-General") of the [Anglo-Egyptian Sudan](/wiki/Anglo-Egyptian_Sudan "Anglo-Egyptian Sudan") and [Sirdar](/wiki/Sirdar "Sirdar") of the Egyptian Army, was shot in [Cairo](/wiki/Cairo "Cairo") by a gang of Egyptian nationalist students, dying the following day.
sources: [Chamberlain, Austen](/wiki/Austen_Chamberlain "Austen Chamberlain") (1995). Self, Robert C. (ed.). *The Austen Chamberlain Diary Letters: The Correspondence of Sir Austen Chamberlain with his sisters Hilda and Ida, 1916–1937*. Cambridge University Press. p. 300. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [0-521-55157-9](/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-521-55157-9 "Special:BookSources/0-521-55157-9").

content: Hollywood producer [Thomas H. Ince](/wiki/Thomas_H._Ince "Thomas H. Ince") died at his estate in California, two days after leaving a gathering attended by many celebrities aboard [William Randolph Hearst](/wiki/William_Randolph_Hearst "William Randolph Hearst")'s private yacht, the *[Oneida](/w/index.php?title=USS_%27%27Oneida%27%27_(SP-432)&action=edit&redlink=1 "USS ''Oneida'' (SP-432) (page does not exist)")*. The cause of death was officially given as a [heart attack](/wiki/Heart_attack "Heart attack"), but wild rumors circulated that he had been shot or somehow otherwise fatally afflicted under circumstances that were covered up. A 2001 film, *[The Cat's Meow](/wiki/The_Cat%27s_Meow "The Cat's Meow")*, is based on the rumors.
sources: [Evert, Roger](/wiki/Roger_Ebert "Roger Ebert") (2004). [*Roger Ebert's Movie Yearbook 2005*](https://archive.org/details/rogerebertsmovie0000eber_m5j7/page/105). Kansas City: Andrews McNell Publishing. p. [105](https://archive.org/details/rogerebertsmovie0000eber_m5j7/page/105). [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [0-7407-4742-8](/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-7407-4742-8 "Special:BookSources/0-7407-4742-8").

Belletti, Valeria (2006). Beauchamp, Cari (ed.). [*Adventures of a Hollywood Secretary: Her Private Letters from Inside the Studios of the 1920s*](https://archive.org/details/adventuresofholl00vale). Berkeley and Los Angeles: University of California Press. pp. [86–89](https://archive.org/details/adventuresofholl00vale/page/86). [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [0-520-24780-9](/wiki/Special:BookSources/0-520-24780-9 "Special:BookSources/0-520-24780-9").

content: The legislature of the [Philippines](/wiki/Philippines "Philippines") passed a resolution calling for complete independence from the United States.
sources: ["Chronology 1924"](http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1924.htm). *indiana.edu*. 2002. Retrieved January 16, 2015.

content:
**Born:**
	* [William Russell](/wiki/William_Russell_(English_actor) "William Russell (English actor)"), British actor, in [Sunderland, Tyne and Wear](/wiki/Sunderland,_Tyne_and_Wear "Sunderland, Tyne and Wear")
	* [J. D. Sumner](/wiki/J._D._Sumner "J. D. Sumner"), American singer, songwriter and music promoter,; in [Lakeland, Florida](/wiki/Lakeland,_Florida "Lakeland, Florida") (d. 1998)
[William Russell](/wiki/William_Russell_(English_actor) "William Russell (English actor)"), British actor, in [Sunderland, Tyne and Wear](/wiki/Sunderland,_Tyne_and_Wear "Sunderland, Tyne and Wear")
[J. D. Sumner](/wiki/J._D._Sumner "J. D. Sumner"), American singer, songwriter and music promoter,; in [Lakeland, Florida](/wiki/Lakeland,_Florida "Lakeland, Florida") (d. 1998)

**Died:** [Thomas H. Ince](/wiki/Thomas_H._Ince "Thomas H. Ince"), 42, American film producer, died of heart failure after he became severely ill aboard the private yacht of media tycoon [William Randolph Hearst](/wiki/William_Randolph_Hearst "William Randolph Hearst").
sources: Taves, Brian. (2012). [Thomas Ince: Hollywood's Independent Producer](https://books.google.com/books?id=H1BRDjArx64C). The University Press of Kentucky. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-8131-3423-9](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-8131-3423-9 "Special:BookSources/978-0-8131-3423-9"). Retrieved 10 January 2016.

content: [Rudolf Ramek](/wiki/Rudolf_Ramek "Rudolf Ramek") became [Chancellor of Austria](/wiki/Chancellor_of_Austria "Chancellor of Austria").

**Born:**
	* [Benoit Mandelbrot](/wiki/Benoit_Mandelbrot "Benoit Mandelbrot"), Polish mathematician; in [Warsaw](/wiki/Warsaw "Warsaw") (d. 2010)
	* [Mark Miller](/wiki/Mark_Miller_(actor) "Mark Miller (actor)"), American actor;, in [Houston](/wiki/Houston "Houston"), [Texas](/wiki/Texas "Texas") (d. 2022)
[Benoit Mandelbrot](/wiki/Benoit_Mandelbrot "Benoit Mandelbrot"), Polish mathematician; in [Warsaw](/wiki/Warsaw "Warsaw") (d. 2010)
[Mark Miller](/wiki/Mark_Miller_(actor) "Mark Miller (actor)"), American actor;, in [Houston](/wiki/Houston "Houston"), [Texas](/wiki/Texas "Texas") (d. 2022)
**Died:** Sir [Lee Stack](/wiki/Lee_Stack "Lee Stack"), 56, British Governor-General of Sudan, died the day after being shot by assassins.

Britain's new [Stanley Baldwin](/wiki/Stanley_Baldwin "Stanley Baldwin") government scrapped the commercial treaties that [Ramsay MacDonald](/wiki/Ramsay_MacDonald "Ramsay MacDonald")'s [Labour](/wiki/Labour_Party_(UK) "Labour Party (UK)") government had negotiated with the Soviet Union.
sources: ["Chronology 1924"](http://www.indiana.edu/~league/1924.htm). *indiana.edu*. 2002. Retrieved January 16, 2015.

content: **Born:** [Warren Hacker](/wiki/Warren_Hacker "Warren Hacker"), American baseball player; in [Marissa, Illinois](/wiki/Marissa,_Illinois "Marissa, Illinois") (d. 2002)

**Died:** [Florence Harding](/wiki/Florence_Harding "Florence Harding"), 64, former [First Lady of the United States](/wiki/First_Lady_of_the_United_States "First Lady of the United States") and widow of [Warren G. Harding](/wiki/Warren_G._Harding "Warren G. Harding")
[Fethi Okyar](/wiki/Fethi_Okyar "Fethi Okyar") became the new [Prime Minister of Turkey](/wiki/Prime_Minister_of_Turkey "Prime Minister of Turkey").

The British government sent a message to Egyptian Prime Minister [Saad Zaghloul](/wiki/Saad_Zaghloul "Saad Zaghloul") demanding complete satisfaction in the matter of the assassination of [Governor-General](/wiki/Governor-General "Governor-General") [Sir Lee Stack](/wiki/Lee_Stack "Lee Stack"), including punishment of those responsible and a payment of £500,000 in compensation. Britain blamed the assassination on the Egyptian government's failure to take steps to suppress anti-British agitation.
sources: "Ultimatum Sent to Egypt". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. November 23, 1924. p. 1.

content: **Born:** [Geraldine Page](/wiki/Geraldine_Page "Geraldine Page"); American actress, in [Kirksville, Missouri](/wiki/Kirksville,_Missouri "Kirksville, Missouri") (d. 1987)

[Edwin Hubble](/wiki/Edwin_Hubble "Edwin Hubble") announced his discovery that [Andromeda](/wiki/Andromeda_Galaxy "Andromeda Galaxy"), previously believed to be a [nebula](/wiki/Nebula "Nebula"), is actually another [galaxy](/wiki/Galaxy "Galaxy"), and that the [Milky Way](/wiki/Milky_Way "Milky Way") is only one of many such galaxies in the universe.
sources: Sharov, Aleksandr Sergeevich; Novikov, Igor Dmitrievich (1993). [*Edwin Hubble, the discoverer of the big bang universe*](https://books.google.com/books?id=ttEwkEdPc70C&pg=PA34). Cambridge University Press. p. 34. [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier) "ISBN (identifier)") [978-0-521-41617-7](/wiki/Special:BookSources/978-0-521-41617-7 "Special:BookSources/978-0-521-41617-7"). Retrieved 2011-12-31.

content: Embattled Italian leader [Benito Mussolini](/wiki/Benito_Mussolini "Benito Mussolini") apologized for the events in Rome on November 4 and promised to take steps to keep his [Blackshirts](/wiki/Milizia_Volontaria_per_la_Sicurezza_Nazionale "Milizia Volontaria per la Sicurezza Nazionale") under control.
sources: Rue, Larry (November 24, 1924). "Mussolini, the Eagle, Coos Like Dove; Saves Job". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 15.

content: **Born:** [Anita Linda](/wiki/Anita_Linda "Anita Linda"); Philippine actress; in [Pasay](/wiki/Pasay "Pasay") (d. 2020)

[Saad Zaghloul](/wiki/Saad_Zaghloul "Saad Zaghloul") was ousted as Egyptian Prime Minister days after the assassination [Sir Lee Stack](/wiki/Lee_Stack "Lee Stack"), Governor-General of Sudan. Zaghloul was succeeded by [Ahmad Ziwar Pasha](/wiki/Ahmad_Ziwar_Pasha "Ahmad Ziwar Pasha").
sources: "New Cabinet in Egypt; League to Get Protest". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. November 25, 1924. p. 1.

content: **Born:** [Joanne Winter](/wiki/Joanne_Winter "Joanne Winter"), American baseball pitcher for the [Racine Belles](/wiki/Racine_Belles "Racine Belles") of the [AAGPBL](/wiki/AAGPBL "AAGPBL"), and the league's all-time career leader in innings pitched (2159) and pitching appearances (287); in [Chicago](/wiki/Chicago "Chicago") (d. 1996)

[Charlie Chaplin](/wiki/Charlie_Chaplin "Charlie Chaplin") married his second wife, [Lita Grey](/wiki/Lita_Grey "Lita Grey"), in [Empalme](/wiki/Empalme,_Sonora "Empalme, Sonora"), [Mexico](/wiki/Mexico "Mexico").
sources: "Chaplin Weds Lita Grey in Mexican Dawn". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. November 26, 1924. p. 1.

content: Radio stations in the United States broadcast an "hour of silence" between 10 and 11 p.m., setting it aside for international broadcasting tests. Listeners as far west as [Duluth, Minnesota](/wiki/Duluth,_Minnesota "Duluth, Minnesota") reported being able to hear broadcasting from England, France and Spain.
sources: "City Gets Europe by Radio". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. November 26, 1924. p. 1.

content: **Born:** [Takaaki Yoshimoto](/wiki/Takaaki_Yoshimoto "Takaaki Yoshimoto"), Japanese poet, critic and philosopher; in [Tokyo](/wiki/Tokyo "Tokyo") (d. 2012)
The [Mongolian People's Republic](/wiki/Mongolian_People%27s_Republic "Mongolian People's Republic") was proclaimed.

The verdicts in the [trial of the 149](/wiki/Trial_of_the_149 "Trial of the 149") were read in [Estonia](/wiki/Estonia "Estonia"). Seven people were acquitted and all the others were sentenced to varying terms of either prison or forced labour.
The first [Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade](/wiki/Macy%27s_Thanksgiving_Day_Parade "Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade") was held in New York City.

[Mussolini](/wiki/Benito_Mussolini "Benito Mussolini")'s newspaper *[Il Popolo d'Italia](/wiki/Il_Popolo_d%27Italia "Il Popolo d'Italia")* warned that [civil war](/wiki/Civil_war "Civil war") would break out unless the opposition ceased its "campaign of defamation."
sources: Rue, Larry (November 29, 1924). "'Me or Deluge,' Mussolini Cry to Italy". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 7.

content: **Born:** [Dennis Brutus](/wiki/Dennis_Brutus "Dennis Brutus"), South African activist, educator, journalist and poet; in [Salisbury](/wiki/Harare "Harare"), [Southern Rhodesia](/wiki/Southern_Rhodesia "Southern Rhodesia") (now Harare, Zimbabwe) (d. 2009)

A public broadcasting station, [NHK (Japan Broadcasting Corporation)](/wiki/NHK "NHK") was founded in Japan, as predecessor name was Tokyo Broadcasting Station.[*[citation needed](/wiki/Wikipedia:Citation_needed "Wikipedia:Citation needed")*]

The [Army–Navy Game](/wiki/Army%E2%80%93Navy_Game "Army–Navy Game") was won by Army 12-0 in [Baltimore](/wiki/Baltimore "Baltimore"). U.S. president [Calvin Coolidge](/wiki/Calvin_Coolidge "Calvin Coolidge") was among the 80,000 in attendance.
sources: "Garbisch Thrills Call and 80,000 as Navy Falls, 12-0". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. November 30, 1924. p. Part 2 p. 1.

content: In the [12th Grey Cup](/wiki/12th_Grey_Cup "12th Grey Cup") of Canadian football, [Queen's University](/wiki/Queen%27s_University_at_Kingston "Queen's University at Kingston") beat the [Toronto Balmy Beach Beachers](/wiki/Toronto_Balmy_Beach_Beachers "Toronto Balmy Beach Beachers") 11-3 at [Varsity Stadium](/wiki/Varsity_Stadium "Varsity Stadium").
The [Montreal Forum](/wiki/Montreal_Forum "Montreal Forum") opened in Canada.
**Born:** [Irv Noren](/wiki/Irv_Noren "Irv Noren"), American baseball player and pro basketball player; in [Jamestown, New York](/wiki/Jamestown,_New_York "Jamestown, New York") (d. 2019)
**Died:** [Giacomo Puccini](/wiki/Giacomo_Puccini "Giacomo Puccini"), 66, Italian composer
The [1924 NFL season](/wiki/1924_NFL_season "1924 NFL season") officially ended with the [Cleveland Bulldogs](/wiki/Cleveland_Bulldogs "Cleveland Bulldogs") atop the standings.

[Plutarco Elías Calles](/wiki/Plutarco_El%C3%ADas_Calles "Plutarco Elías Calles") was inaugurated as the 40th [president of Mexico](/wiki/President_of_Mexico "President of Mexico"). The National Stadium in [Mexico City](/wiki/Mexico_City "Mexico City") was packed for the event that only lasted fifteen minutes.
sources: Cornyn, John (December 1, 1924). "Calles Takes Presidency of Mexico". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 1.

content: Editor of British newspaper *[The People](/wiki/The_Sunday_People "The Sunday People")* [Hannen Swaffer](/wiki/Hannen_Swaffer "Hannen Swaffer") recounted a [séance](/wiki/S%C3%A9ance "Séance") he attended along with [Arthur Conan Doyle](/wiki/Arthur_Conan_Doyle "Arthur Conan Doyle"), [Sir Robert McAlpine](/wiki/Sir_Robert_McAlpine,_1st_Baronet "Sir Robert McAlpine, 1st Baronet") and others. Swaffer said that the medium contacted [Lord Northcliffe](/wiki/Alfred_Harmsworth,_1st_Viscount_Northcliffe "Alfred Harmsworth, 1st Viscount Northcliffe"), who admitted that Doyle was right about life beyond the grave. "I distrusted your judgement, but I see now how wrong I was", the spirit voice of Northcliffe was quoted as saying.
sources: Steele, John (December 1, 1924). "Northcliffe "Speaks from Spirit Land"". *[Chicago Daily Tribune](/wiki/Chicago_Daily_Tribune "Chicago Daily Tribune")*. p. 1.

content: **Born:** [Allan Sherman](/wiki/Allan_Sherman "Allan Sherman"), American comedy writer and song parodist, in [Chicago](/wiki/Chicago "Chicago") (d. 1973)
